intro: Lactuca floridana var. villosa, commonly known as the Florida lettuce, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its hairy, lobed leaves and small, yellow flowers that bloom in the summer. The plant belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is often found in wetlands and disturbed soils. Its leaves are typically used in traditional medicine for their purported healing properties. The species is relatively rare and is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations to its native habitat.
